figure_1.title: Figure 1:
figure_1.caption: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically affected keratoconus eye of a patient from this study

figure_2.title: Figure 2:
figure_2.caption: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically unaffected eye (subclinical asymmetric keratoconus) fellow eye from the same patient shown in Figure 1.

figure_3.title: Figure 3:
figure_3.caption: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from a bilaterally normal topography and tomography eye of a patient from this study.

figure_4.title: Figure 4:
figure_4.caption: Asphericity asymmetry Index (AAI) calculation. Adding the absolute value of the maximum positive elevation and the maximum negative depression values within the 6mm zone of the best fit toric aspheric (BFTA) posterior elevation map in 180ø opposite 45° zones, yields the AAI. In this example, AAI = +15 + (15) = 30.

claims.sentence:
Figure 1:

Open in a new tab
Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically affected keratoconus eye of a patient from this studyFigure 2:

Open in a new tab
Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically unaffected eye (subclinical asymmetric keratoconus) fellow eye from the same patient shown in Figure 1.The Control group comprised of patients with pre-operative bilateral normal topography and tomography maps who all underwent LASIK at Emory with at least one-year uneventful follow-up (Figure 3).

Figure 3:

Open in a new tab
Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from a bilaterally normal topography and tomography eye of a patient from this study.Dual Scheimpflug/Placido Device Parameters
All measurements were performed with the Galilei dual Scheimpflug analyzer (G2 and G4, Ziemer Ophthalmic Systems AG; Port, Switzerland) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

The Posterior AAI was obtained through manual calculations as previously described.35,36 The Posterior AAI is calculated using the BFTA map as the absolute value of the highest negative elevation and highest positive elevation value within the posterior central 6-mm diameter data zone, 180° opposite 45° zones (Figure 4).

Figure 4:

Open in a new tab
Asphericity asymmetry Index (AAI) calculation.
